Package javelin.controller.challenge

Class RewardCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.challenge.RewardCalculator
  • public class RewardCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Determines experience points and treasure to be awarded after winning a battle. Rules for this are found in the core d20 rules and also on Upper Krust's work which is repackaged with permition on the 'doc' directory.
    Author:
    alex

      • rewardxp

        public static java.lang.String rewardxp​(java.util.List<Combatant> originalblue,
                                        java.util.List<Combatant> originalred,
                                        float bonus)
        Calculates proper experience reward for a given battle and distributes in a non-uniform manner. d20 level caps are exponential but since Javelin uses challenge rating as XP it becomes more linear - to circumvent that this method distributes 1 xp part to the strongest unit (including it's xp bank), 2 to the second strongest, etc. This may look random at first but in the long run ensures Combatants will level up in a balanced manner, with lower level units gaining levels faster than already strong units - which is what the d20 system is designed to do.
        Parameters:
        winners - Combatants to award XP to.
        originalblue - Allied team that started the battle.
        originalred - Battle opponent.
        bonus - Multiplier bonus.
        Returns:
        A string representing how much XP was gained by the party.
        See Also:
        Combatant.xp

      • distributexp

        public static void distributexp​(java.util.List<Combatant> units,
                                double xp)
        This discounts a linear parcel for any mercenaries involved and then distributes the remainder in a non-linear parcel according to unit power, with weaker units receiving more XP, as to emulate offical d20 XP progressions. This is necessary because Javelin actually uses a CR value (100XP = 1CR) instead of the official exponential XP tables.
        Parameters:
        units - Combatants to receive experience.
        xp - Total amount of experience to be distributed.
        See Also:
        #rewardxp(ArrayList, List, List, int)
